overview:
Molly E. Holzschlag (born 1963) is a lecturer and author of over 35 books related to web design and markup. She has been named one of the Top 25 Most Influential Women on the Web. She currently is an Opera Software employee,[1] and serves as a member of the CSS[2] and as an invited expert to the HTML working groups of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). Formerly Group Lead of the Web Standards Project (WaSP), Molly has consulted for major organizations including Microsoft, AOL, eBay and the BBC. Through these roles, Molly promotes standards and best practices to create highly sustainable, maintainable, accessible, interactive and beautiful Web sites for the global community.

Molly is the co-author, with Dave Shea, of the influential book The Zen of CSS Design: Visual Enlightenment for the Web, published in 2005.
